    • Method Detail

      • render

        public int[] render(int[] pixels)
        Renders what the player is seeing through Camera. Renders into an array of ints (pixels) through ray-casting.

        This algorithm goes through each vertical strip of the pixels array and calculates the distance between the location of the player and the wall. The distance is then used to calculate the height of the wall (perspective) in that strip. The algorithm retrieves the color values of the pixels in the texture, and applies them to each pixel in the new line. The new pixel array is returned.

        Parameters:
        {@code - int} array of pixels (rgb value for each pixel.
        Returns:
        updated pixels array.
        See Also:
        Ray-Casting

      • fillBackground

        private int[] fillBackground(int[] pixels)
